intro: Onosma stenosiphon var. glabriuscula, commonly known as the smooth-leaved onosma, is a flowering plant native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae, characterized by its hairy or woolly stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with five petals and a distinct central tube.
